alert.note: Alert for North Central (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Excessive Heat Warning issued June 18 at 12:08PM ADT until June 18 at 6:00PM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM AST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...A Excessive Heat Warning is in effect from 11 AM AST until 5 PM AST this afternoon due to possible excessive heat index values reaching or exceeding 112 degrees Fahrenheit. * WHERE...For the north-central coast of Puerto Rico. * WHEN...through 5 PM AST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...The combination of hot temperatures and high humidity will create dangerous situations in which heat related illnesses are likely.
info.instruction: An Excessive Heat Warning means that a prolonged period of dangerously hot temperatures will occur. The combination of hot temperatures and high humidity will combine to create a DANGEROUS SITUATION in which heat illnesses are likely. Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Take extra precautions, if you work or spend time outside. When possible, reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear light weight and loose fitting clothing when possible and drink plenty of water. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency, call 9 1 1.
